column4: Wow im having so many issues with the Ubuntu way, but not the linux way.
Everytime I try to boot into a text mode login, I get "ubuntu is running in low-graphics mode" :/
Well I meant for example, Ubuntu way as in it uses rc-sys file instead of /etc/inittab.

The init scripts/milestones are different in most unix-like operating systems. You may read a little about it and learn the differences between Debian-style init, Red Hat-style init, and Unix milestones. There's plenty of stuff on the web.
